snippet: An emergency petition by conservative groups has raised new legal questions and prompted lawyers for same-sex couples to file a federal motion demanding that Alabama’s attorney general dismiss the petition.
abstract: Emergency petition filed by two conservative groups asking Alabama's Supreme Court to stop issuing marriage licenses to same-sex couples sows more confusion among state's probate judges, who have been getting conflicting signs from judiciaries; petition raises new legal questions and prompts lawyers for gay couples to file federal motion asking petition be dismissed.
lead_paragraph: An emergency petition by conservative groups has raised new legal questions and prompted lawyers for same-sex couples to file a federal motion demanding that Alabama’s attorney general dismiss the petition.

headline.main: Fresh Challenge to Gay Marriage Increases Confusion in Alabama
headline.print_headline: Fresh Challenge to Gay Marriage Increases Confusion in Alabama

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
